doc:
Margaret Bert https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Bert 0 Margaret Bert (June 4, 1896 – May 1, 1971) was an American character actress who was most active from the 1930s through the 1950s. She was born on June 4, 1896 in Blackburn, Lancashire. She began her film career during the silent film era, having a small, unnamed role in the 1926 film, The Blackbird, starring Lon Chaney. During her lengthy career, Bert appeared in more than 150 feature films, film shorts, and television shows, mostly in un-credited roles, with many of those being as an unnamed player. Occasionally, she would be given a larger supporting role, such as when she was cast as Mrs. Rogers in the 1947 comedy-drama, Sarge Goes to College. With the advent of television, she would make several appearances on the small screen, including roles on The Roy Rogers Show, The Adventures of Jim Bowie, and The Walter Winchell File. Her final performance was in a small role on the classic television sit-com Petticoat Junction in 1964. Bert died on May 1, 1971 in Sacramento, California. Margaret_Bert ( June_4_,_1896 – May_1_,_1971 ) was an_American_character_actress who was most_active from the_1930s through the_1950s . She was_born on June_4_,_1896 in Blackburn , Lancashire . She began her_film_career during the_silent_film_era , having a_small_,_unnamed_role in the_1926_film , The_Blackbird , starring Lon_Chaney . During her_lengthy_career , Bert appeared in more_than_150_feature_films , film_shorts , and television_shows , mostly in un-credited_roles , with many of those_being as an_unnamed_player . Occasionally , she would_be_given a_larger_supporting_role , such_as when she was_cast as Mrs._Rogers in the_1947_comedy-drama , Sarge Goes to College . With the_advent of television , she would_make several_appearances on the_small_screen , including roles on The_Roy_Rogers_Show , The_Adventures of Jim_Bowie , and The_Walter_Winchell_File . Her_final_performance was in a_small_role on the_classic_television_sit-com_Petticoat_Junction in 1964 . Bert died on May_1 , 1971 in Sacramento , California .
